item.description:
Concert by Two Old Friends

Saturday, August 18, 2012

2:00 p.m.

in the Elm Street Gallery at the Millyard Museum

Included with regular admission to the Millyard Museum

Light refreshments will be served. 

Also today: Opening of a new exhibit - Eric Sanford - Photographer

Two Old Friends return to the Millyard Museum to once again delight the audience with a combination of Irish and American country music.  With banjo, guitar, mandolin, concertina, bodran, octave mandolin and heartwarming vocal harmonies, Two Old Friends tell a story in music of how immigrants came to this country from Ireland, Scotland and Great Britain, bringing their melodies and instruments with them. "Mac" McHale and Emery "Hutch" Hutchins show how the old time country ballads of the Appalachians are rooted in this music. Their performance will give you plaintive ballads and foot stomping shout tunes; soaring mandolin solos, gospel sing-a-longs, traditional Irish songs and storytelling. There is truly something for everyone to enjoy!

 

Mac and Hutch are two of New England’s most talented traditional musicians. They were the founders and original long-time members of Northeast Winds. Mac, who lives in Kennebunk, Maine, heads up Mac McHale and the Old Time Radio Gang, and Hutch, of York, Maine, was a key member of the world famous Irish group, the Angel Band.
item.name: Concert - Two Old Friends
